Great News from the GPS Food & Nutrition Department!

We recently received notice that the USDA has extended all COVID-19 meal waivers through December 31, 2020. This means, all students enrolled in Greenville Public Schools will be able to receive breakfast AND lunch at no cost!

Any GHS and GMS students who want to purchase extra food or drink items (ala carte) will need to have funds in their online lunch accounts. Students bringing their meals from home may also purchase milk for $0.50. Students are not allowed to make extra purchases with a negative balance in their account.

Deposits into the student online accounts may be made at: www.SendMoneyToSchool.com.

If you have any questions or need help obtaining your students ID#, you may contact Kate Bradley at bradleka@gpsmi.us or 616-754-2907.

Thank you and we look forward to serving your students this year!

GPS Students Supporting Students - Initiated by GHS junior Anna Thompson, the concept of this opportunity is partnering NHS & NJHS students with younger students to provide peer-to-peer support (using technology) during the mandated school closure. In no way is this a replacement of parents or teachers as the first best presence in students' lives. It is meant as an additional support or supplement for those who are interested.

If this is an option you wish to explore for your student, please check out the flyer for additional information and click on the link for an electronic form to sign up your student.

Secondary (middle & high school) students who wish to mentor may contact their NHS or NJHS advisor (GHS: Mian Fisher at fishermi@gpsmi.us / GMS: Cassandra Fletcher at fletcherc@gpsmi.us).

Please feel free to email Asst. Superintendent Michelle Blaszczynski at blaszczm@gpsmi.us with any questions or concerns regarding this student-led initiative.

#jacketpride #inspiringexcellence

Due to the current shelter in place order, our Pre-K registration has been cancelled. We will run registration a bit different this year (this is for all GPS preschool programs). Follow the below steps for registration:

1. Complete the application at the following link: e https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfhsnJpPQQmFmFHuJdzANTEUm_tuHvDvsB9nfQA9_I1u-Zlkw/viewform If you do not have online access, please email and a paper copy will be sent to you.
2. Collect your child's birth certificate, immunization records and your household proof of income (paystub, tax returns, etc.) so you can submit then once you have been contacted about enrollment.
3. Once your application has been processed, you will be contacted to complete the enrollment process.

Please know that this process may take a bit longer than in the past due to only essential staff working. If you have questions at all during this process, please email Keisha Peters at petersk@gpsmi.us
